required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Effectiveness of Rehabilitation Services for Survivors of Acute Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Effectiveness of Rehabilitation Services for Survivors of Acute Ischemic Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective analysis of Get With the Guidelines-Stroke data linked with Medicare claims and the AVAIL longitudinal data sets to assess patterns, predictors, and outcomes associated with the use of rehabilitation services following hospitalization for ischemic stroke. Primary completion defined as the end of primary analyses, consistent with the end of the PCORI Cycle I grant period. Study completion defined as acceptance of final research report and lay abstract by PCORI.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators will seek to answer three questions:
1. What are the person- and system-level factors associated with use of rehabilitation services following acute ischemic stroke?
2. Among stroke survivors discharged to short-term inpatient rehabilitation, are high-intensity services performed at an Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility (IRF) more effective than lower intensity services performed at a Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF), at improving patient outcomes at 3 and 12 months?
3. Among stroke survivors discharged home, is early follow-up with a physician more effective than follow-up after 7 days at 3 and 12 months?

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Receiving Inpatient, Home, or Community Based Rehabilitation Services
primary_outcome.description: Received either inpatient care in an inpatient rehabilitation or skilled nursing facility, or home or community-based rehabilitation.
Number of days alive and living outside of inpatient care

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Functionally Dependent or Dead 12 Months After Hospital Discharge
secondary_outcome.description: 12-month functional status as measured by modified Rankin scale scores ranging between 0 (no symptoms) and 6 (death), among patients discharged to inpatient rehabilitation or skilled nursing facility. Outcome measure reports number of participants with Rankin score of 3-6. The outcome was not assessed among patients discharged home.

EuroQOL-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) to assess health-related quality of life by asking and scoring the level of severity (1 = no problems, 2 = some problems, 3 = extreme problems) in 5 dimensions of health: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Score for each question is added together to provide total score, which is converted to provide a range from 1 (maximum and highest health state for quality of life) down to 0 (lowest health state and quality of life).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Institutionalized in a Nursing Home for Long-term Care Within 12 Months of Hospital Discharge.
secondary_outcome.description: Institutionalization (primary living location in a nursing home for long-term care and not for rehabilitation or short-term skilled stay) as measured by patient or proxy family member report on 12-month follow-up phone call.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Were Rehospitalized or Died Within 12 Months of Stroke Hospitalization.
secondary_outcome.description: All-cause rehospitalization or death within 12 months of index stroke hospitalization as indicated in Medicare claims files.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died Within 12 Months of Stroke Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Death within 12 months of discharge from index stroke hospitalization as indicated in Medicare claims files

intervention.description: Analysis of data for patients hospitalized in 2006-2008 with acute ischemic stroke, and successfully linked with Medicare claims through 2009

study_pop.textblock: Patients hospitalized for acute ischemic stroke in 2006-2008, and successfully linked to Medicare claims available through 2009

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- acute ischemic stroke within the Get With the Guidelines-Stroke data set for 2006-2008, and successfully linked to Medicare claims through 2009
Exclusion Criteria:
- death during index hospitalization

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Starting population = 164,246 acute ischemic stroke patients with data in Get With the Guidelines linked to Medicare fee-for-service (FFS) claims. This was a retrospective analysis of existing data, so there were no patient milestones.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The following exclusions were applied prior to group assignment: death during index admission (n=10,466); loss of FFS eligibility not due to death during follow-up (n=1683); discharged to Federal hospital (n=102); transferred to another acute care hospital or discharged directly to nursing home for long-term care (n=4279).

group.title: Inpatient Rehab Facility (IRF)
group.description: Discharged from hospital to inpatient rehabilitation facility

group.title: Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF)
group.description: Discharged from hospital to skilled nursing facility

group.title: Discharged Home
group.description: Discharged from hospital to home with or without services

baseline.population: Acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry with Medicare fee-for-service health insurance. Differentiation into study arms by discharge location meets the first primary aim of the study, to describe rehab service use through 90 days.

group.title: Inpatient Rehab Facility (IRF)
group.description: Discharged from hospital to Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility

group.title: Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF)
group.description: Discharged from hospital to Skilled Nursing Facility

group.title: Discharged Home
group.description: Discharged from hospital to home with or without services

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: All analyses calculated by comparing only non-missing values.

measure.title: Sex/Gender, Customized
measure.description: All analyses calculated by comparing only non-missing values. Gender missing among 5 patients discharged to IRF, and 2 patients discharged to SNF.

measure.title: Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
measure.description: All analyses calculated by comparing only non-missing values.

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.description: All analyses calculated by comparing only non-missing values. Hispanic ethnicity collected as a category under Race, prior to revision of collection standards to match NIH/OMB.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Participants Receiving Inpatient, Home, or Community Based Rehabilitation Services
outcome.description: Received either inpatient care in an inpatient rehabilitation or skilled nursing facility, or home or community-based rehabilitation.
outcome.population: Acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry with Medicare fee-for-service health insurance, analyzed as one cohort rather than by arm to differentiate the different types of rehabilitation services within the full patient population.

group.title: All Patients
group.description: Examined descriptively for all patients in the study in order to differentiate the different types of rehabilitation services for the full stroke patient population.

measure.title: Number of Participants Receiving Inpatient, Home, or Community Based Rehabilitation Services
measure.description: Received either inpatient care in an inpatient rehabilitation or skilled nursing facility, or home or community-based rehabilitation.
measure.population: Acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry with Medicare fee-for-service health insurance, analyzed as one cohort rather than by arm to differentiate the different types of rehabilitation services within the full patient population.

outcome.title: Home-time
outcome.description: Number of days alive and living outside of inpatient care
outcome.population: Acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry with Medicare fee-for-service health insurance, discharged to inpatient rehab or skilled nursing care and without survival limitations identified in-hospital. 69,212 patients met these criteria.

group.title: Inpatient Rehab Facility (IRF)
group.description: Discharged from hospital to Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility

group.title: Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF)
group.description: Discharged from hospital to Skilled Nursing Facility

measure.title: Home-time
measure.description: Number of days alive and living outside of inpatient care
measure.population: Acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry with Medicare fee-for-service health insurance, discharged to inpatient rehab or skilled nursing care and without survival limitations identified in-hospital. 69,212 patients met these criteria.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Were Functionally Dependent or Dead 12 Months After Hospital Discharge
outcome.description: 12-month functional status as measured by modified Rankin scale scores ranging between 0 (no symptoms) and 6 (death), among patients discharged to inpatient rehabilitation or skilled nursing facility. Outcome measure reports number of participants with Rankin score of 3-6. The outcome was not assessed among patients discharged home.
outcome.population: Acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry discharged to inpatient rehabilitation or skilled nursing facility, without survival limitations identified in-hospital and with 12-month follow-up as part of the Adherence Evaluation After Ischemic Stroke Longitudinal (AVAIL) registry. 473 participants met these criteria.

outcome.population: Acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry discharged to inpatient rehabilitation or skilled nursing facility, without survival limitations identified in-hospital and with 12-month follow-up as part of the Adherence Evaluation After Ischemic Stroke Longitudinal (AVAIL) registry. 323 patients met these criteria.

reported_events.desc: This was a retrospective analysis of pre-existing data for acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry with Medicare fee-for-service health insurance, or with 12-month follow-up as part of the Adherence Evaluation After Ischemic Stroke Longitudinal (AVAIL) registry. Adverse events were not assessed.

group.title: All Patients
group.description: Not applicable. This was a retrospective analysis of pre-existing data for acute ischemic stroke patients in the Get With the Guidelines registry with 12-month follow-up as part of the Adherence Evaluation After Ischemic Stroke Longitudinal (AVAIL) registry.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
